title: 'White-collar terror module, red car': What's emerging in Delhi blast probe - key points
content: A "white-collar terror module" is under investigation following a deadly blast at Delhi's Red Fort, which killed 12. Clues include a missing red Ford EcoSport and links to Al Falah University, where the suspected bomber was an assistant professor. A car dealer has been detained as police trace the explosive-laden Hyundai i20's ownership.

title: Delhi blast: Doc fired for terror links 'taught' at Al-Falah University; manhunt on
content: A Faridabad-based private university, Al-Falah, is facing increased scrutiny following reports linking its staff to a recent blast near Delhi's Red Fort. The university confirmed the detention of two doctors by investigating agencies, while also denying any connection to the incident beyond their employment.

title: Ranji Trophy: How words of wisdom from Dravid, Jadeja inspired Brar; takes 6-fer vs C'garh
content: After years of frustration, Harpreet Brar finally made his first-class debut for Punjab at 30. Guided by words of encouragement from Rahul Dravid and Ravindra Jadeja, the left-arm spinner revived his red-ball ambitions.

title: Trump eases pressure on China: Export ban delayed; markets breathe easier
content: The Trump administration has postponed a significant export control rule targeting Chinese companies for a year, a key concession in the recent U.S.-China trade truce. This move eases tensions, allowing American tech exporters a reprieve from complex compliance. While a temporary detente, the rule's potential return in 2026 signals ongoing scrutiny.

title: Kabul plays Trump card? Taliban may curb trade with Pak; looking for alternatives
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government is seeking alternative trade routes through Central Asia as border closures with Pakistan cripple commerce, costing nearly $200 million monthly. Accusing Islamabad of politically motivated restrictions and exploiting traders, Kabul urges strengthening ties with Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Turkmenistan amid collapsed bilateral talks and escalating cross-border hostilities.

title: IND vs SA | Cape Town carnage: When tons from Sachin & Azharuddin couldn't save India
content: As India and South Africa prepare for their upcoming Test series, the legendary 222-run partnership between Sachin Tendulkar and Mohammad Azharuddin in Cape Town 1997 evokes memories of India's fighting spirit. This iconic stand, forged under immense pressure, showcased India's fighting spirit, even as they fell to a mountain first innings deficit against the hosts.

title: Delhi blast: TMC MP raises issue in House panel; chairperson refuses discussion - report
content: A parliamentary committee on home affairs declined to discuss a deadly car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station, despite the incident claiming 12 lives and raising security concerns. A TMC MP's attempt to raise the issue was reportedly shut down by the chairperson, even as disaster management officials were present.

title: LinkedIn founder responds to Pope Leo XIV; says tech is good or bad by its use
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman pushes back against Pope Leo XIV's call for ethical AI development. Hoffman insists technology's moral value rests on human choices, not inherent design. He argues for continued AI acceleration with careful guidance. Hoffman also opposes AI systems marketed as emotional companions. He believes early AI adopters will gain economic and cultural dominance.

title: Trump asks pardon for Netanyahu in corruption cases; sends letter to Israeli President
content: US President Donald Trump has urged Israeli President Isaac Herzog to consider pardoning Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces corruption charges. Trump labelled the prosecution 'political' and 'unjustified.' Herzog's office confirmed receipt of the letter, stating a formal pardon request must follow established procedures. Netanyahu denies all allegations.

title: Historic debut! Sehwag’s stunning century vs South Africa - Throwback
content: As India and South Africa prepare for a Test series, the article revisits Virender Sehwag's Test debut against the Proteas in 2001. Known as the Nawab of Najafgarh, Sehwag's Test career spanned 104 matches, during which he accumulated 8,586 runs with a strike rate of 82.23. His Test record includes 23 centuries and 32 half-centuries, along with 40 wickets as a part-time bowler.

title: From Umar to Muzammil: Who are the six doctors behind Delhi Red Fort blast
content: A trans-state white-collar terror module involving doctors, clerics, and professionals, linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, was unearthed after a high-intensity explosion near Delhi's Red Fort. Joint operations led to the arrest of seven suspects and the recovery of over 2,900 kg of explosives and firearms.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's AI chief, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, likening the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant future economic advantage, much like early programmers. This rapid, iterative approach is key to understanding and maximizing AI's potential.

title: The 13 lives of Surinder: 19 years on, closure for Koli, none for Nithari
content: Convicted serial killer Surinder Koli, infamous for the Nithari murders, is set for release after a Supreme Court acquittal in his final case. Having spent 19 years in jail, Koli's journey saw a dramatic shift from volatile behavior to quiet meditation. He will now begin a new life after his dramatic legal journey concludes.

title: IND vs SA: Why there will be tea before lunch during the Guwahati Test — Explained
content: The second India-South Africa Test in Guwahati will feature revised timings and a modified session schedule, with play starting 30 minutes earlier due to early sunset in the region. In a unique adjustment, tea will be taken before lunch for the match, which marks Guwahati's Test debut. The first Test of the series is set to be played in Kolkata.

title: 'No contact': Shaheen's brother breaks silence; kin struggle to believe terror link
content: Family members of arrested doctor Shaheen Sayeed expressed shock and disbelief over her alleged links to a terror module responsible for the Red Fort car blast. Her brother and former husband described her as a loving person, unaware of any suspicious activities. Investigators claim Sayeed headed Jaish-e-Mohammed's women's recruitment wing.

title: Delhi blast: PM Modi meets victims at LNJP Hospital; to hold key security meet soon
content: Prime Minister Modi, returning from Bhutan, visited Delhi car blast victims, assuring justice for perpetrators. He vowed to uncover the conspiracy, stating those responsible "won't be spared." Home minister Amit Shah also directed officials to "hunt down each and every culprit" behind the explosion that claimed at least 12 lives near the Red Fort.

title: Sania Mirza confesses being a single mom is ‘very hard’
content: Filmmaker Farah Khan and tennis star Sania Mirza opened up about life, friendship, and the challenges of single motherhood. Mirza shared her struggles, while Khan discussed societal views on hardship and the normalization of divorce. Khan lauded Mirza's strength as a single parent, recounting a moment of panic where she rushed to support her friend.

title: World’s longest-married couple reveals secret to their lasting relationship
content: At 107 and 108 years old, Eleanor and Lyle Gittens are the world's longest-married couple, celebrating 83 years together. Their secret, they say, is simple: "We love each other." Their enduring love story began in 1941 and survived war, distance, and time, proving that consistent love is the key to a lasting union.

title: Retail inflation at record low! October CPI inflation drops to 0.25%
content: India's retail inflation hit a decade low in October 2025, reaching 0.25%. Food prices saw a significant drop, contributing to this decline. This positive trend was influenced by factors like GST reductions and a favorable base effect. Both rural and urban areas experienced lower inflation rates. This marks a significant economic development for the nation.

title: 'IB, CBI ... ': Kharge slams agencies on Delhi blast; calls it 'govt failure'
content: A car exploded near Delhi's Red Fort metro station. Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the government's security. He demanded a thorough investigation and strict punishment for those responsible. The incident highlights governance failures in the capital. Investigations are ongoing into the blast's cause. The government is exploring all angles, including a possible suicide bombing.

title: Gold price today: How much does the yellow metal cost? Check city-wise rates
content: Gold prices saw a slight increase on Wednesday, influenced by global market gains and renewed optimism about potential US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts next month. Silver also mirrored this upward trend.

title: Grigor Dimitrov: Cozy Costa Rica pics with Eiza González spark buzz
content: Tennis star Grigor Dimitrov and actress Eiza González are enjoying a relaxing off-season in Costa Rica following Dimitrov's injury-plagued 2025 season. González shared photos of their getaway, showcasing moments of them enjoying nature. She has been a strong supporter of Dimitrov, especially after his early withdrawal from Wimbledon due to injury.

title: Delhi blast: Explosion threw victims against wall; autopsies reveal ruptured lungs
content: A deadly car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening killed at least 12 people. Post-mortem reports reveal severe injuries, including ruptured organs and multiple fractures, indicating a high-intensity blast. The National Investigation Agency has taken over the terror-related incident probe.

title: Annika Sorenstam reacts after watching Kai Trump’s LPGA debut at Pelican Golf Club
content: Donald Trump's granddaughter, 18-year-old Kai Trump, is making her LPGA debut at The Annika tournament in Florida.  LPGA legend Annika Sorenstam praised Kai's game and maturity, noting her ability to handle pressure. Sorenstam urged everyone to support the young golfer as she embarks on her professional career, emphasizing her passion for the sport.

title: 'Don't harass parents': Mufti urges agencies as probe into Delhi car blast widens
content: Jammu and Kashmir PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged authorities to conduct a fair probe into the Delhi blast and avoid harassing parents of arrested doctors. Families of the accused also claim innocence, stating they are unaware of their relatives' alleged involvement. The investigation into the blast and explosives recovery continues.

title: Was Red Fort attack planned for January 26? What Faridabad doctor's phone revealed
content: Police are investigating if the recent Red Fort blast was part of a foiled plot targeting Republic Day. Suspect Dr Muzammil Ganaie conducted multiple reconnaissance visits to the Red Fort area in January 2025, suggesting a planned attack on January 26. This plan may have been thwarted by heightened security during the celebrations.

title: Where did it go wrong? 1st Nithari investigator recalls delays that doomed probe
content: Nithari village hid horrors for months before 2006 discoveries. A missing woman's complaint led to an investigation.  The case relied heavily on a confession from domestic help Surinder Koli.  Police faced procedural challenges.  Later, Koli was freed in many cases due to doubts about his confession and evidence.

title: Dhruv Jurel to play Eden Test - Ryan ten Doeschate confirms India's combination
content: In-form wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel is confirmed to play in India's opening Test against South Africa, a decision driven by his stellar recent performances, including two centuries for India A. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate indicated Jurel will feature alongside Rishabh Pant, likely as a specialist batter.

title: Indian football’s crisis: AIFF Super Cup semifinalists to play on - 'Business as usual'
content: East Bengal, Punjab FC, FC Goa and Mumbai City FC players will resume training soon in preparation for the AIFF Super Cup semi-finals on December 4 and 5.  It comes at a time of uncertainty over their futures and players urging stakeholders to find a solution to the ISL limbo.

title: Rashid Khan breaks silence on 'second marriage' rumours
content: Afghanistan's cricket star Rashid Khan has clarified viral rumors of a secret second wedding. He confirmed his marriage, which took place on August 2nd, 2025, stating his wife accompanied him to a charity event. This marks his second marriage, with his first occurring in October 2024. Khan's public acknowledgment has ended speculation.

title: Trump’s ‘wage-weighted’ H-1B visa plan: Nasscom issues big warning
content: The Trump administration's proposed shift from an H-1B visa lottery to a wage-weighted system faces strong criticism from Nasscom and other trade bodies. Concerns include operational disruption, potential for manipulation, and negative impacts on early-career professionals and small businesses. Critics argue the move is economically flawed and legally questionable.

title: Red Fort blast probe: Mother’s DNA to be matched to confirm identity of lone wolf fidayeen
content: Delhi Police are using DNA from a severed arm to identify the lone wolf fidayeen bomber near Red Fort. Investigators believe Dr. Umar Un Nabi, a doctor from Pulwama, carried out the attack. Evidence suggests a Jaish-e-Muhammed module was involved, seeking revenge. Raids are ongoing to apprehend other members.

title: 'She is my wife, nothing to hide': Rashid Khan clarifies viral photo, confirms marriage
content: Afghanistan's star cricketer Rashid Khan has officially confirmed the identity of the woman in a viral photograph from a charity event. He revealed on Instagram that she is his wife, whom he married in August. Rashid clarified that the speculation was unnecessary and emphasized their commitment to transparency, redirecting focus to his foundation's humanitarian work.

title: Faridabad’s Al-Falah University breaks silence on terror probe— Here’s what they said
content: Al-Falah University has issued a statement addressing recent allegations, clarifying its role and condemning "baseless and misleading stories" online. The university confirmed two doctors were detained but not acting in official capacities, and denied any prohibited materials were used on campus. They pledged full cooperation with investigations and reaffirmed commitment to academic excellence and national security.

title: Delhi blast: Impact lifted and dropped my cab like a toy, survivor recalls
content: A cab driver, Sakir, recounts his harrowing escape from a blast in Delhi, describing his car being violently shaken and windows shattering. He sustained burns but feels fortunate compared to others in the ICU.  Doctors are providing excellent care, and he anticipates a swift discharge. His survival highlights the resilience of victims amidst the chaos.

title: Lionel Messi's Hyderabad visit confirmed - Check details
content: Football legend Lionel Messi is set to visit Hyderabad on December 13, 2025, as part of his 'GOAT India Tour 2025'. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy confirmed the visit, highlighting it as a proud moment for the state. The tour will also include stops in Kolkata, Mumbai, and New Delhi, culminating in a grand event in Mumbai.

title: ‘I wanna get off!’: Panic inside US metro as driver dozes off; train races through tunnel
content: A San Francisco train driver fell asleep at the controls, causing a packed Muni metro train to dangerously accelerate through a curve. Panicked passengers were thrown to the floor, with one requiring treatment for a concussion. The SFMTA attributed the incident to operator fatigue after an investigation found no mechanical issues.

title: Turkey cargo plane crash: All 20 aboard killed near Georgia-Azerbaijan border
content: A Turkish military C-130 cargo plane crashed in Georgia near the Azerbaijani border, killing all twenty personnel aboard. The aircraft, en route from Azerbaijan to Turkey, lost contact with authorities shortly after entering Georgian airspace. An investigation into the cause of the crash is underway.

title: Why India should push for rollback Russia oil penalty before Trump trade deal
content: India should push for the rollback of 25% tariffs on Russian crude oil before finalizing a trade deal with the US, according to GTRI founder Ajay Srivastava. This move, coupled with India's reduced Russian oil imports, could enhance market access and boost competitiveness in key sectors.

title: Watch: Moment i20 car burst into fireball on busy Red Fort street
content: A devastating blast ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Delhi's Red Fort, claiming at least 12 lives and injuring many. The explosion, occurring during peak evening traffic, engulfed several vehicles in flames. The car, parked for two hours, is linked to a Pulwama owner, with investigators exploring potential terror links and a suspect in an explosives case.

title: Shami's Test snub: 'A clear indicator' - Ex-India assistant coach's bold statement
content: Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar believes Mohammed Shami's omission from the South Africa Test squad signals a future-looking approach by the team management. Nayar highlighted Akash Deep's inclusion as a strategic investment, citing his familiarity with conditions and consistent domestic performances. He also emphasized the current squad's strength and adaptability across various surfaces.

title: Leaders should not raise meaningless demands, says Ashok Chandargi
content: Congress MLA Raju Kage says statehood demand is based on a genuine need for development of the region

title: BJP condemns YSRCP’s negative propaganda on PPP
content: PPP is not privatisation, but a partnership between government and private institutions for 33 years to ensure better health facilities, says BJP State spokesperson

title: BJP’s Aparajita Sarangi to chair joint panel of Parliament on bills to remove PM, CMs
content: With key opposition parties announcing a boycott of the committee, the 31-member panel has four members from the opposition ranks

title: Shivakumar to chair meeting tomorrow on Tungabhadra water release
content: The Deputy Chief Minister will chair the 125th meeting of the Tungabhadra Irrigation Consultative Committee at the Vidhana Soudha

title: Shelter shortage, poor planning slow stray dog control in Vijayawada
content: While the Supreme Court’s order to move stray dogs into shelters after sterilisation draws protests from animal lovers, civic officials in Vijayawada grapple with limited kennels and disorganised birth control drives

title: T.N. Raj Bhavan petrol bomb attack case: Accused ‘Karukka’ Vinoth sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment
content: The Special Court for National Investigation Agency (NIA) cases in Poonamallee that found the 39-year-old history-sheeter guilty also imposed a fine of ₹5,000.

title: Andhra Pradesh launches Building Penalisation Scheme
content: The scheme provides one final chance for property owners to legalise their unauthorised and deviated structures built between January 1, 1985 and August 31, 2025

title: Maoist with ₹5 lakh reward on head surrenders in Jharkhand’s Latehar
content: The two were identified as sub-zonal commander Brajesh Yadav of Gumla district and area commander Awdhesh Lohra alias Rohit Lohra of Latehar district

title: SC fixes January 21 for final hearing on Uddhav Thackeray faction's plea on Shiv Sena symbol row
content: The top court also fixed three hours for hearing arguments from each faction of the political parties

title: Teachers’ association flags delayed salaries at Himachal Pradesh University
content: The State government’s decision to shift the university’s funding of staff salaries on the basis of grant-in-aid instead of a regular budget had created recurrent financial uncertainty, the association’s president said

title: Delhi blast: Police step up inspections in Kerala’s Kozhikode district
content: Police are conducting random inspections with the support of bomb detection and disposal squads as part of the heightened surveillance measures in Kerala

title: New setback rules for buildings in Bengaluru on plots up to 150 sqm, mechanized parking allowed on top floors and terrace
content: Amendments to Zoning Regulations of Revised Master Plan - 2015 have been put out for public scrutiny and objections, if any, can be filed in the next 30 days

title: ‘Respite Home’ for the differently abled to give caregivers a break
content: Social Justice department plans three homes where the differently abled can be temporarily accommodated for up to seven days, allowing their caregivers to take time off for emergencies

title: APCRDA clears illegal layouts across Amaravati capital region; warns public against buying unapproved plots
content: On November 10, APCRDA cleared 14 unauthorised layouts covering approximately 35 acres of land in various locations across the region

title: Kerala’s power sector plans crisis and disaster management framework in line with new Central Electricity Authority norms
content: KSEB’s decision comes at a time when State's power sector has been reporting heavy damage to its infrastructure in natural calamities and storms, especially during monsoon months

title: IMD issues cold-wave warning for seven Jharkhand districts till November 15
content: IMD issued a “yellow” alert for seven districts: Garhwa, Palamu, Chatra, Latehar, Lohardaga, Gumla, and Simdega from November 12 to 15

title: Delhi blast: PM Modi meets injured at LNJP Hospital, vows to bring guilty to justice
content: While in the hospital, PM Modi interacted with the injured and enquired about their health and he was also briefed by senior officials, doctors about the condition of the victims and the treatment being provided

title: Supreme Court orders immediate release of Delhi lawyer arrested by Haryana STF in murder case
content: Supreme Court orders the release of Delhi lawyer Vikram Singh, detained in a murder case, citing lack of grounds for arrest; protests from bar associations highlight concerns over police practices

title: Trinamool criticises BJP over Shantanu Thakur’s derogatory remarks on Mamata Banerjee
content: TMC accuses BJP of institutionalising misogyny, says repeated attacks on the CM reflect leaders’ deep-seated insecurity

title: Prakrit and Kannada scholar, Bengaluru-based scientist among six winners of Infosys Prize 2025
content: The Infosys Prize honours the accomplishments of individuals whose research and scholarship significantly impact India

title: Jammu Police call for public alert on suspicious movements; install CCTV cameras
content: “We have asked the people to remain alert about any suspicious movement in their areas,” says Deputy Superintendent of Police

title: Supreme Court wants High Court Judges' ability to deliver judgments in time to be in public domain
content: 'Let everybody know how many judgments have been reserved by any Judge and how many are pronounced; within how many days the judgments are made available in the public domain; and how many days High Courts actually take to upload judgments'

title: Vijay accuses DMK of spreading slander against TVK
content: Mr. Vijay said the ruling party was making baseless allegations against the TVK, though his party’s criticism of the DMK had been mild and expressed with civility

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF declares 70 candidates in battle for Kochi Corporation
content: List includes nine sitting councillors, 16 former members and seven candidates under the age of 40. The total representation of women is 56%

title: Supreme Court Bench to hear if litigant should first approach sessions court for anticipatory bail
content: Supreme Court refers a key question on anticipatory bail procedures to a three-Judge Bench, seeking clarity on High Court jurisdiction versus sessions court requirements

title: Fake call centre targeting U.S., Canadian citizens busted in Mumbai; five held
content: “They were cheating U.S. and Canadian citizens by offering them quick loans and fraudulently obtaining proceeds of crime via gift cards or crypto,” police said

title: Bihar Assembly elections 2025: Clean sweep for Mahagathbandhan, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: Tejashwi Yadav also raised questions on the credibility of the exit polls and surveys conducted by the agencies

title: GBA Chief Commissioner inspects ongoing infrastructure work in Bengaluru
content: He instructed that a mass cleanliness drive be undertaken along high-density corridor roads to remove waste, debris, and silt from footpaths

title: Mizoram bags special award for traffic management
content: For award selection, Mizoram's Town & Country Planning Wing of the UD & PA Department was invited to make a presentation before the award selection committee, says official statement

title: Rajapalayam double murder case: accused shot during escape bid, say police
content: On Monday night, two security personnel were hacked to death inside a temple at Devadanam during a robbery attempt

title: Suspected kidney racket creates flutter in Andhra’s Madanapalle after death of Visakhapatnam woman
content: Yamuna’s husband lodged a complaint with the Visakhapatnam police after she failed to return home, despite a week having passed amid unanswered phone calls

title: Navy chief begins five-day visit to United States
content: Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi will also visit key U.S. naval institutions and commands to discuss shared priorities in the Indo-Pacific and collaboration in multilateral initiatives

title: J-K Police raids over 300 locations linked to banned Jamaat-e-Islami
content: The raids were based on credible intelligence inputs indicating attempts by JeI-linked elements to revive their activities under different fronts, police officials said

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT weighs invoking anti-corruption Act as probe nears TDB higher-ups
content: Officials say SIT had sought Kerala High Court’s prior sanction to invoke Prevention of Corruption Act to plug potential legal loopholes

title: Man caught sexually harassing physically challenged woman
content: The accused has been identified as Vikram, a resident of LR Nagar and unemployed staying close to the victim’s house

title: PM Modi degree row: HC asks DU to file reply on pleas to condone delay in filing appeals
content: A Bench of Chief Justice Devendra Kumar Upadhyaya and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela granted three weeks to the varsity to file its objection to the pleas

title: Woman among four militants arrested in Manipur
content: “Two active cadres of the banned People's Liberation Army involved in extortion, were arrested from Dibong Sanakhong area in Jiribam district,” police said

title: Pune techie held for 'terror' links: ATS questions Thane teacher
content: The ATS nabbed the 37-year-old engineer for his alleged links with banned outfits, such as Al Qaeda and Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent, and for his suspected involvement in radicalisation activities

title: PM Modi departs for New Delhi after concluding two-day state visit to Bhutan
content: The Prime Minister also inaugurated the Punatsanchchhu-II project along with King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck following their wide-ranging talks

title: Understanding culture crucial to making translation effective, says Booker Prize winner Deepa Bhasthi
content: Translation is a complex process. Language also carries various aspects of culture with it, says winner of International Booker Prize Deepa Bhasthi

title: Namma Metro services on Yellow Line in Bengaluru briefly affected due to technical snag; fourth since launch
content: According to officials, the issue led to delays in train operations, causing inconvenience to commuters during the peak morning rush

title: Jaishankar meets counterpart Anita Anand on G7 sidelines, discusses rebuilding India-Canada ties
content: The External Affairs Minister’s trip to Canada comes a month after Ms. Anand visited India during which both sides unveiled an ambitious roadmap to boost ties in areas of trade, critical minerals and energy

title: Kerala local body election 2025: Mayors not in fray in civic polls, but may have a larger political responsibility awaiting them
content: Kozhikode Mayor Beena Philip and Kochi Mayor M. Anilkumar express a desire to return to organisational roles in their parties, while Thrissur Mayor M.K. Varghese hints at political ambitions. Thiruvananthapuram Mayor Arya Rajendran also appears to be primed for a larger political assignment

title: Foundation stone laid for ₹47.85-crore project to draw water from Khachur Barrage for Sedam in Karnataka
content: The project will provide a permanent solution to Sedam’s drinking water problem, says Minister Sharan Prakash Patil

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin congratulates art director Thotta Tharani on Chevalier honour
content: Mr. Stalin said Mr. Tharani, an alumnus of the Government College of Fine Arts, has brought great pride by joining the distinguished list of Indian personalities who have received this honour

title: Kerala local body polls: State Election Commission to keep a tab on use of AI
content: The commission will deploy experts across the State to ensure compliance with new guidelines aimed at identifying and labelling synthetic content, and maintaining level-playing field in the electoral arena.

title: Small political parties plan to make it big in Kerala local body polls
content: Twenty20 Kizhakkambalam, Revolutionary Marxist Party (RMP), Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), Welfare Party of India (WPI), Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), and the All-India Trinamool Congress (AITC) are among the main players in this category

title: Chhattisgarh to be free of Maoism before 2026, says CM Vishnu Deo Sai
content: Chhattisgarh government signed ₹33,000 crore investment MoUs with Gujarat firms during two-day summit

title: Maharashtra Transport Minister instructs to start AI-driven toll collection system
content: “Every day, the congestion hinders ambulances, school buses and essential services and also adds to pollution, wasting the time of passengers”

title: Centre approves CBI probe into Odisha recruitment scam
content: At present, the Crime Branch of the State Government is investigating the case following serious allegations of large-scale irregularities and corruption in the recruitment examination

title: IIT Bombay invites applications for advanced programmes in cybersecurity and software development
content: Cybersecurity and software development programmes to begin in January; applications open till December 31.

title: Bihar Assembly elections highlights: NDA, INDIA bloc upbeat about win ahead of results
content: The exit polls conducted by various organisations predicted a return of the NDA government in the State, a poor show for the Opposition ‘Mahagathbandhan’.

title: ‘Predictable tactic’: India strongly trashes Pakistan PM's allegations following terror attack in Islamabad
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said the international community is well aware of the reality and will not be misled by Pakistan's "desperate" ploys

title: How Tamil Nadu witnessed the dramatic arrest and release of Karunanidhi and Stalin in 2001
content: In June 2001, former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi’s midnight arrest sparked political outrage. Police dragged him from his home and later arrested M.K. Stalin and others in connection with alleged irregularities in the construction of 10 flyovers in Chennai

title: Tamil Nadu among top achievers at Udyog Samagam 2025
content: The Udyog Samagam 2025, held under the aegis of the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) in New Delhi, was chaired by Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal.

title: When a car bomb was dismantled after four tense days in Tamil Nadu
content: Killing at least 13 persons, a high intensity bomb blast in a slow moving car near the Red Fort in New Delhi on November 10, 2025 has rocked the country and a terror angle is being probed. About 27 years ago, 60 kg of gelatin explosives planted in an abandoned car at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu were removed after four nerve-wracking days and detonated.

title: KIFF centenary tributes: Bengal’s film fraternity hails Ritwik Ghatak as ‘voice of Partition, pioneer of alternative cinema’
content: As part of the centenary tribute, the 31st KIFF organised screenings of six of Ghatak’s films during the festival between November 6 and November 13, along with an exhibition with his memorabilia at Nandan, the panel discussion today, and the Ritwik Ghatak Memorial Conversation between filmmakers Adoor Gopalakrishnan and Anup Singh, scheduled for November 12

title: ‘Unacceptable’: Supreme Court condemns alleged assault of Kerala students in Delhi
content: The top court said that such acts of racial discrimination were wholly “unacceptable” in a country founded on pluralism

title: CBI arrests ‘conman’ and his associate in impersonation and bribery case
content: On November 10, the two accused were caught in Delhi while receiving ₹18 lakh from one Jagjit Singh Gill, sent by Vinod Parihar, CEO of Cybdeer Network Private Limited

title: Cong. alleges ‘vote chori’ in Kochi Corporation
content: District Congress Committee alleges attempts to add voters using the same house number with different house names and forged rental pacts

title: Rajasthan Chief Secretary Sudhansh Pant shifted to Centre
content: Sudhansh Pant’s sudden transfer to the Centre, following an approval by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) and coming just 14 months before his retirement, has raised speculations in the political and administrative circles in Jaipur

title: Let's get mad! Why Miami and Texas Tech top our Week 12 Anger Index
content: After jumping up three spots, Miami still has plenty to be upset about, but what other teams should be mad?

title: Sources: Giants set to start Winston vs. Packers
content: The Giants are expected to start quarterback Jameis Winston against the Packers, sources told ESPN, turning to him over Russell Wilson after rookie Jaxson Dart suffered a concussion against the Bears.

title: Source: CB Alexander stepping away from football
content: Former Pro Bowl cornerback Jaire Alexander has decided to step away from football in order to focus on getting right physically and mentally amid his ongoing recovery from offseason knee surgery, a league source confirmed to ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Green questions Warriors' commitment to winning
content: After the Warriors were blown out by the Thunder on Tuesday for their sixth consecutive road loss, Draymond Green was asked to describe the difference between how they finished last season following the Jimmy Butler trade and what is happening now.

title: NBA presents new ASG format, selection process
content: The NBA announced its overhauled All-Star Game format, including how Adam Silver will make sure the American and International teams both hit their quota of players.

title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: The top five teams remained unchanged in the second set of rankings released by the College Football Playoff selection committee, with Ohio State at No. 1, followed by fellow unbeatens Indiana and Texas A&M then one-loss Alabama and Georgia.

title: Dombrowski has 'good conversation' with Harper
content: Dave Dombrowski, Phillies president of baseball operations, said he had a long conversation with star Bryce Harper recently but wouldn't go into specifics about what the two discussed.

title: Fiery Christie promises Kings will 'get it right'

content: The less moderated online spaces provided by Telegram have also enabled extremists to reach wider masses and do self-promotion, brand development, and propaganda dissemination.

title: Slow-Moving Traffic, Then Big Explosion: CCTV Footage Of Delhi Red Fort Blast
content: Video footage of the bomb blast that ripped through Delhi's Red Fort surfaced today, amid an ongoing investigation into the terror attack that claimed nine lives earlier this week.

title: Bilaspur Train Accident: Probe Reveals Loco Pilot Didn't Clear Aptitude Test
content: At least eleven people were killed and 20 were injured in one of the most horrific train accidents in recent memory when the Gevra-Bilaspur MEMU passenger train rammed a stationary freight train near Lal Khadan, close to Bilaspur's Gatora station.

title: Sample Taken From Delhi Blast Site More Powerful Than Ammonium Nitrate: Sources
content: Not just ammonium nitrate, high-grade explosives were also used in the blast that occurred near the Red Fort in Delhi, an official from the Forensic Science Laboratory said.

title: Adani Cement To Deploy World's 1st 'RotoDynamic Heater' To Reduce Emissions
content: Adani Cement and Finnish company Coolbrook on Wednesday announced to deploy world's first commercial RotoDynamic Heater' to advance cement decarbonisation at the Boyareddypalli Integrated Cement Plant in Andhra Pradesh.

title: "Act Of War": Government Sources Say "Op Sindoor On" After Delhi Blast
content: In a warning to perpetrators of the Delhi terror blast, government sources reiterated that any terror operation on Indian soil will be considered an act of war.

title: PM Modi, Bhutan's Fourth King Discuss Bilateral Ties, Cultural Bonds
content: On Tuesday, Prime Minister Modi and Bhutanese King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck held extensive discussions covering a wide spectrum of cooperation, including energy, capacity building, connectivity, technology, defence, and security.

title: 'Rs 58 Crore, Global Links': Police Probe One Of Biggest Digital Arrests
content: The Maharashtra Cyber Department probing the Rs 58 crore digital arrest case in Mumbai has found an international network with links extending to Hong Kong, China and Indonesia, an official said on Tuesday.

title: NCP "Never Misused Power Nor Acted Arrogantly": Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, who heads the ruling NCP, on Tuesday said people continue to repose faith in his party because of its commitment to development and welfare-oriented politics.

title: 'No Changes': Google Denies Removing Western Sahara Border For Morocco Users
content: The dotted lines illustrating the border between Western Sahara and Morocco, indicating the former's disputed territory status, have never been visible to people using Google Maps in the latter, the company told AFP on Tuesday.

title: Bill To Allow 8 Republicans To Seek Damages For Capitol Riot Probe
content: Legislation moving through Congress that would end the government shutdown in the US would also allow eight Republican senators to seek hundreds of thousands of dollars in damages for the capitol riot probe done by the Biden administration.

title: Delhi Blast Victim's Family Wanted Funeral In Hometown Meerut, Wife Refused
content: Mohsin, a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, was killed in Monday's car bomb blast near Red Fort, Delhi. An argument broke out over the place of his burial.

title: Car Used In Delhi Bomb Blast Was First Seen At Connaught Place, Mayur Vihar
content: The white Hyundai i20 car that exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing nine people, was first seen at Connaught Place and Mayur Vihar hours before the blast.

content: The Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) team investigating the car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort has recovered two live cartridges and samples of two different types of explosives on Tuesday, sources said.
